alert.note: Alert for Mt. Hood National Forest - West of Cascade Crest; North Oregon Cascade Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 23 at 5:00AM PDT until August 25 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: Corrected headlines. ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING ACROSS ZONES 605, 607, AND 660... .After a brief period of cooler temperatures and higher relative humidity, hot and dry conditions will return Thursday as high pressure builds back into the region. The initial concern will be gusty east winds and low relative humidity Thursday, then a disturbance aloft may trigger thunderstorms with abundant lightning Thursday night into Friday morning. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOLLOWED BY THUNDERSTORMS WITH ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 605, 607, AND 660... * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 605 North Oregon Cascade Foothills and Fire Weather Zone 607 Mt. Hood National Forest West of Cascade Crest. In Washington, Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills. * WINDS...East 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum RH Thursday of 15 to 20 percent. Poor to moderate humidity recoveries expected Thursday night, with elevated and exposed locations only expected to recover to 35 to 45 percent by Friday morning. * THUNDERSTORMS...Thunderstorms may produce abundant lightning Thursday night into Friday morning, with LAL of up to 4 possible. * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid fire spread which may threaten life and property. Use extra caution with potential ignition sources, especially in grassy areas. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Abundant lightning Thursday night into Friday morning may cause several new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Mt. Hood National Forest - West of Cascade Crest; North Oregon Cascade Foothills
